Reviews.Title: Not bad, but there are a ton of better options
Reviews.Author: V. Yalung
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Sears a few months ago for my bedroom, when they had it on sale for about 500 dollars. I thought at the time that 500 bucks (+tax) was a good deal on the relatively new LED technology, and the guy who worked there sold me on the fact that it takes about 1/4 the amount of electricity that my Vizio plasma uses. However, I later found that for a bit more, I can get quality name brands online, like the Panasonic that I recently bought and reviewed on Amazon.I saw this on gold box today, and I thought I would let people know what they are getting, so here it is- first, you are getting a bare bones TV that is okay to watch on. The picture is actually pretty nice, when compared to older LCDs, and almost comparable to my favorite screen, the plasma. The picture is not as rich as plasma, but definitely more natural looking than the older 60hz lcds.Anyway, here's the skinny:It has 3 HDMI inputs, which is nice, even for a living room set, and more than enough for use as a bedroom TV. There is also a PC connection so you can use it as a computer monitor, but I have yet to try that. It is VERY lightweight, compared to my 42 inch plasma, and most people will be able to mount it on their walls without the help of a second person. The picture, as I have said is very nice, when compared to other TV's in this price range, but it is a bit on the dim side. When setting the brightness higher, you will notice some "flashlight effect," if you're really paying attention, but most people looking at a cheap TV probably won't even notice, or mind too much. There aren't all the cool "new for 2011" features that most TV's have these days, like internet and Netflix, but if you connect your XBox or PS3 to the set, or a internet capable Bluray, it won't really matter. I wouldn't really consider this a good buy, only because the name brand is generic and you never know what kind of service and reliability you'll get from a company that sells discount (read:cheap) electronics, and if you just spent a hundred dollars or so more, you can get something that may last you quite a while. But, if you don't have the bread to spend, you want to get a TV with great picture and don't mind not having all the bells and whistles, I'll guess you'll be okay with this one. Just don't forget to find a cheap warranty, maybe at Costco or something.*Update 12-16*I uploaded some pictures to demonstrate the flashlight effect that I mentioned in my review, and to give some alternate views of this set, because there aren't any other pics of this TV anywhere on the web. I don't understand why people think that what I've written is unhelpful, but I've tried to be thorough and objective in writing about a TV that I think is a good value, but could be improved. If you ask me a question, I'd be happy to help you make a decision.

Reviews.Title: Great Value LED
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I got this TV on sale via Amazon Lightning Deals. It is definitely worth a 400 price tag. The speakers can be loud, but obviously with this thin TV, don't expect any bass. The picture looks great on this LED, and I personally didn't notice any edge bleeding while watching X-men Origin in blu-ray. If you see this item go on sale, snatch it up! However, I'd have to say it's only mediocre at its normal price. Not bad, but for a few more $$$, you could get a name brand. All in all though, I'm happy with this TV.Unfortunately, this TV does not has any analog sound output. Only digital coax and TOSLINK. So if you want to hook up speakers without a receiver, you'll need a digital converter. However, if you have a receiver with coax/TOSLINK, the coax or TOSLINK output on the TV will work just fine. Not worth deducting a star on, since this seems to be the way all TV's are headed(digital). Just a heads up, as I was disappointed when I saw no headphone jack or RCA outputs.

Reviews.Title: Lit up my room for dark scenes
Reviews.Author: Jermaine Stewart "stewy_gt"
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Great picture quality once the TV warms up (takes about 15 seconds).- Speakers are perfectly usable as-is and loud enough.- Nice, slim design (thick bezel though).Cons:- Absolutely horrible flashlight effect.- Still see some amount of noise (not bad though) when watching HD content (watched RIO blu-ray with PS3).- USB connection is ONLY for servicing (manual states that it should not be used by end users).- Takes about 10 seconds between pressing the power button on the remote and seeing a picture.- All default color profiles were very off (not so bad as the settings can be changed to get acceptable colors).I must admit that I was skeptical about purchasing this TV due to reviews I read for other TVs for the company. However, I saw the TV on the Lightning deal and figured that the price was right. So I bought it as a gift for my girlfriend. After receiving the TV we set it up (just connect the base) that night and hooked up the PS3 with a blu-ray copy of RIO. While watching the movie, all I remembered hearing was "No, this is not going to work." as my girlfriend watched with great disappointment. The flashlight effect was horrible. It looked as though there were four bright flashlights with the light coming from all four corners of the TV with the light almost extending all the way to the center to make an X. If that wasn't bad enough, there was some additional light coming from the top and bottom edge and a big horizontal blur of light that was half way between the center and the top of the TV. We could tolerate it for bright scenes even though the corner lights were clearly visible due to the black bars at the top and bottom of the picture (letter-boxing). However, darker scenes were just horrible. At one point the light from the top left corner was washing out the picture for such a colorful movie.As a gift that she wanted for a long time, this was not how I envisioned things turning out. I must admit that the picture quality (HD only, never checked SD) does look great, and the sound isn't an issue; plus the sound can easily be improved by connecting a good sound system. None of the default settings looked close to correct in color (I have other HDTVs, one of which was ISF calibrated). This would have been a good TV for the money (provided it lasts) if not for the poor lighting. I never expected it to be perfect, just acceptable. This one is going back.

Reviews.Title: Great low budget LED TV (updated 7/24/2013)
Reviews.Author: FireWynd "FireWynd"
Reviews.Content: Update July 24, 2013:1.5 years later and the TV is still solid. No problems. It see's ~2 hours of daily use on average. I re-read my original review and agree with everything I said when I posted the review. All the pros and cons are still applicable 2 years later. If it means much, it hasn't developed any new problems. Additionally none of the cons that I mentioned below have got worse. Very happy with the purchase.Original review from ~December 2011Picked up for $340 - an amazing price. The next closest (in price) 40" LCD/LED TV we could find on Amazon was a LG w/ bad reviews for $500. We bought this as a hold me over TV for a the next few years. Figure with Apple TV coming out soon, that could revolutionize the TV industry. OLED and voice-enabled TVs, along with more internet integration are coming within the next few years. I couldn't justify buying a more expensive set that would become out-dated so quickly. So this TV fits the bill.Despite it's flaws, you get what you paid for. Seeing how this was almost 1/2 the price of any other 40" TV on amazon, we knew what we were probably going to get as far as quality and was fine with that.PROS:-true 1080p-No dead pixels-Works-Nothing outstandingly bad-Amazing value (quality for price)-Lots of hookups (3x HDMI and it either had component or composite too). Also has an old VGA plugin (no DVI). This means if you don't have an AV Receiver, then you in good shape since you can probably hook all your devices to this. 3x HDMI gives you (for instance): 1x BD Player, 1x Xbox 360, 1x PS3. Anyhow this is more than enough for most households. Oh and it has an old school coax hookup for those of you with older cable boxes. Tested this and it works for us!Neutral:We have a nice Onkyo AV Receiver with a nice surround sound system. So we never even bothered trying out the sound on the TV.CONS:- Some flashlights in corners, the upper left and right being the worst. But it's not that bad. I've seen much worse and for a set at this price point - it's to be expected. You won't notice it at all in light scenes. In very dark scenes (like in Underworld), if you pay extremely close attention, you might notice it. Frankly, I don't notice it during movies. You can only really see it when you first turn on the TV and everything is black. Personally, this isn't a major issue. Worth mentioning for those of you who care.- Noise. The picture when you sit close looks has a lot of noise / static to it. This is not very noticeable on light scenes, but on dark scenes it can be very noticeable. The picture is still 1080p HD for sure, so it's not that. Just imagine taking a top end Samsung HDTV picture quality, and then add a bunch of noise to it. This is noise, _not_ pixelation (what happens in high compression JPEGs). If your thinking pixelation, then stop, because this is not that. The pixels are fine, it is true 1080p. There is a big difference between the two! If you ever played Mass Effect or Mass Effect 2 on PC/XBox 360/PS3, it is like the movie filter that you can turn on which adds a bunch of noise. It's pretty much exactly like that. It's not terrible. Again the picture is still 1080p HD w/ some added background noise. However this means you will _not_ get a clean, clear, crisp picture like on other more expensive sets. That said, you get what you paid for, and it isn't bad enough to ruin our movie watching experience. However we upgraded from a 36" 480i CRT set. So compared to that, this thing is amazing. If you are coming from a high quality HDTV set to this, you would probably notice and it will probably really irritate you. For me, and for the price, I'm fine with it. If this is your first HDTV or your not a picture quality nazi, then this is a minor point.- Ghosting. On really fast scenes - you will see some ghosting. I was surprised to see ghosting since I thought I read that the response time was 5ms which is what you look for in computer monitors for gaming. But either that's a lie, or there's another problem. Anyhow watching Underworld (a very dark-scened vampire action movie with Kate Beckinsale) in the first 1/2 hour or so, it was only _really_ bad once. Still sucks though, and personally I find the ghosting much more distracting than the noise or flashlights. But considering the ghosting only lasted around 5-10 seconds out of 30 minutes, well I can get over that too for this price. But of the three problems, at least for me, this was by far the worst because it is very noticeable when it occurs. Oddly enough my wife didn't notice it, but it was very obvious to me.Bottom line:Has some flaws. But honestly, for $380 or ~1/2 price of competing HDTV sets - if you expected perfection, then your insane. You get what you pay for. If you want perfection, then I recommend you shell out the $800-900 for a 40" LED Samsung set which is more than double what you would pay for this.I personally find the flash-lighting to be a non-issue. The noise I don't really find to be much of a problem either. The worst part of the set for me is the ghosting, because when ghosting happens - it's _very_ noticeable.Having said all that, I knew that for such a ridiculously low priced set, that the quality probably wasn't going to be amazing. I knew that going in and honestly, it pretty much meets expectations or possibly exceeds them. The extra hookups (not useful for us due to our AV receiver) was a big surprise for a low-priced set.Also LED and not LCD. This will up the resale value significantly. Our plan is to resell this on craigslist in a few years and shell out the $1000+ for a nice Samsung. Because this is LED and not LCD - the resale value of this set is significant. We expect to get most of our money back.I rate this highly for it's price point  / value - it delivers and honestly was even better than I was expecting. Had no problems hooking up to our AV receiver. Pass-through from our BD Player was just perfect. No major problems. I'm very happy with it.For those looking for perfection: Spend 2-3x more than this and buy a Samsung set. For those on a major budget, and therefore understand perfection isn't happening and are fine with that - this set is for you.

Reviews.Title: Stay away
Reviews.Author: Heat2012
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a xmas gift for my girlfriend in a November lightning deal. What a mistake. The box this TV is shipped in was so weak, I noticed gashes on the sides with no foam support. I immediately opened the box to find that the screen had in fact been scratched. Amazon took care of it no problem and I was able to get another one before xmas.After my girlfriend finally sets up the TV in January, that is when I notice the other problems. I know for the $400 price I paid, I wasn't going to get the greatest quality TV, but I wasn't expecting this. Pretty much all the problems everyone else is talking about. No matter what you do to the settings, the picture never looks remotely right. The four lamps create excessive bleeding on the corners. The volume is limited, but it honestly did not bother me as much it seems to everyone else. I felt very guilty in having given this piece of crap as a gift. Even if my gf was more optimistic about it than me. I think she just liked the idea of owning a big LED TV. Until 5 months later.One night, the TV just crapped out on her. She was watching something and bam, audio but no video whatsoever. I came over to verify and there was nothing I could do. The TV would turn on, but the screen had burnt out. After 5 months of minimal use! We spend more time at my place watching TV on my 5 year old Sony, and this thing couldn't even make it to half a year.You think, okay, Coby should have some warranty to cover this. Don't bother. Their warranty only last 90 days. After that you have to pay almost $100 in shipping and labor fees. What a joke. I refused to pay an extra $100 that could have gone to a better TV.I went to my last resort, Amazon. Once again, Amazon's exceptional customer service really came through. Who else would let me return a TV purchased in November for almost a full refund? It is this kind of service that keeps me coming back.I know there are quite a few people defending this TV. But when the amount of 5 star reviews is less than the 1 star reviews, that should really say something.

Reviews.Title: Great product!  Unbelievable value!
Reviews.Author: S. Ghaemi
Reviews.Content: I was looking for 2 36inch TV's for a couple of rooms in my house.  I looked every where and found a few options but a little over the budget.  A friend of mine suggested this item.  I looked into it and found it to be the best deal out there.  The picture is sharp.  Easy to set up and most important a great value for a 40inch TV.  I liked it so much that I ended up buying the 19inch one for my kitchen.I highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture quality fair acoustics.
Reviews.Author: Curtis Mason
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is very good but like my Vizio the speakers mediocre. Being a LED it is very thin and light. I have now purchased 3 of these for my health club where people do not need to hear the speakers.EDIT: I have now bought 4 of these for my Health Club.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, speakers get in the way even when on mute
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is ok for the price. I'm sure you can get better but you'd pay a lot more. Now for the bad:- The built in speakers are horrible. I turned the TV on mute and ran the sound through my receiver, however the speakers keep crackling, and there is an audible background noise coming out of them.- I wish the panel swiveled on the stand. Not an issue if you mount it on a wall, but on a stand, it's impractical to turn the whole assembly if you want to change the viewing angle.

Reviews.Title: You don't even get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Assmanof
Reviews.Content: Okay this is my first review but I think it is necessary. I own many different tv types from rear projection, crt, led, lcd, as well as plasmas. This Coby was going into my sons room, so it just needed to have an okay picture, not really expecting much. Well the picture was soo bad I had given up on it within 15 min.Pros:Price - CheapForm factor - Fairly thin but gets thicker in the center section still good thoughCons:Sound - Well it is bad but not really expecting much on an led tv, so you can ignore this con unless your used to other tv types. This didn't affect my rating.Picture - Flash lighting on all four corners! I had brightness turned all the way down and still it was unacceptable. Also this set has the worst clouding issue I have ever seen. When the picture goes even remotely dark, these bright patches of light bleed all over the screen. This alone is grounds for return. And if that isn't bad enough there is a major noise issue with any content. I had the same channel going to this tv and my Samsung lcd and it was like night and day. There were all sorts of artifacts and noise that weren't present in the Samsung. And there are not enough adjustments to make the picture even halfway decent. I didn't even have enough time with the set to check on ghosting but I'm sure that was there too. It didn't matter if it was standard or high definition, the picture was just bad.Summary: I understand this is not a high end tv but it isn't even worth it at the low price its at now. What good is a tv that's unwatchable? Coming from somebody who knows what a good tv picture should look like please stay away from this set. I regret wasting my time with this set and will stick to name brands like I've always done, with exception of this one time. This one is going back.

Reviews.Title: Poorly designed product!
Reviews.Author: Tyler C. Derrick "TCDerrick"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV (40" 4026) with low expectations AFTER reading the reviews, but loved the $299 price point for a 3rd TV for the bedroom.  I own 2 Panasonic Viera Plasma's ('07 50" and '11 60"), so I know what an HDTV should look like. I even asked myself "How bad could it really be?". I now have my answer, bad.What I liked:Price ($299 when purchased, $465 at time of review, sooo...).  Picture is nice in bright scenes. Light, thin and easy to mount.  Plenty of connection options.Here are my 2 major issues that are grounds for returning:Flashlight Effect: If the ambient light is bright, it is hard to notice, but can still see light bleeding in from the four corners in dark scenes.  When the ambient room light is dark (how we mostly watch it), it becomes noticable in most scenes and truly obnoxious in dark scenes.  It's not just the four corners, but light blotches all over the outer portions of the top and bottom of the screen.  I tried ALL different settings, nothing worked.  Would have thought the product was simply defective had I not read other reviews.Screen Dimming:  Every time you turn off the TV, it resets itself to an "Energy Saving" mode. When you turn the TV back on, you have to cycle through the screen modes until you notice the brightness return, and then set the TV to which mode you want (cinema, vivid, custom etc.).  I use a universal remote, which compounds the annoyance factor.  I called Coby USA, and the rep said "that's just how the TV works"...really?Minor Issues:Nobody has pointed this out, and I didn't notice a problem with the refresh rate, but the title and product comparison chart says "120Hz", yet the product description and actual refresh rate is 60Hz.  False advertising?Sound is sub-par, but hooked it up to a sound bar.  Connections don't seem sturdy.  I connected a RCA coax for the audio out and and Apple 30pin to component setup and I felt like the female connectors were going to cave into the frame.  Luckily, both were planned as a one-time connection.  Power cord is REALLY short, about 4ft.

Reviews.Title: I'll probably return it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Unlike other reviews, the sound on mine is fine, it's the image that's the problem. I can see light bleeding from the corners. Also, when the images are slow/still, it looks great but when there's fast movement, it gets pixelated. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Dim picture, then nothing
Reviews.Author: James T. Griffin
Reviews.Content: This TV had (has) mixed reviews, but the price was right.  When I first turned it on, it worked fine.  A few hours later (still the first day I had it), the screen became very dim, like half brightness or less.  Using the settings, I could see that it was still set up exactly the same as when I took it out of the box.  But switching from "standard" to "vivid" or "sports" or one of the other pre-programmed settings made the brightness pop back up to full brightness.  It did this the next 4 or 5 times I used it, then the 2nd day I had it, the screen went off in the middle of watching it and has never come back on again.  Just black; won't power up.  Seemed nice the few hours it worked...

Reviews.Title: coby LED TV4626 1080p hdtv 46inch
Reviews.Author: jrose
Reviews.Content: I am NOT happy with this purchase. I bought it as my 2 year old LCD started getting a shadow & my father owns a LED which was very nice and 3d like- I don't know if I got a faulty one but on a darker screen it illuminates brighter light of white around the edges of the tv making it annoying to watch any "dark" movie (I don't know if this is broken or just the way it is) also the tv is not 3d like at all, it has a pretty good picture but really no better then my LCD has shown. I was expecting more and like I said may have a faulty one, I plan on calling the company about this light issue, but am angry I have to do that on a new purchase & get worried this may just be a crappy tv. Guess you get what you you pay for. And finding the warranty from Coby, yeah not as easy, I also purchased the square trade 3 year warranty so we will see if this works! Anticipating a lot of headaches!***********UPDATE VERY IMPORTANT TO PAST & FUTURE PURCHASE*********** 5/31/12ok so I returned my old tv as the colby company wanted to repair it and the squaretrade warranty wasnt in effect till a year (arg) I was angry to get a repair on a new tv told amazon & they were awesome & just sent me a new one- now here is the thing- the new tv they sent the so called same replacement they sent was different, this new tv on the back mounting area only had small screw holes for mounting when my original one had these screw plugs then you can put in the screws and the new tv screen was a bit more matte then the original screen- THE NEW ONE IS 110% BETTER in every way!! This new tv picture is so much more crisp and clear then the other one and so far does not have the annoying bright light bleeding around the edges. It does seem to take some time to "warm up" but I do not mind that at all, and I can't comment on the sound other people do because I do have a sound system, but I think I could tolerate the original sound even though it is not that great nor that bad.So my findings show that if you own the 46"led that has the screw plug inserts instead of just a flat mount with screw holes is you got screwed too!!!! It must be an older model and I would return it, the difference is amazing and this is wrong for coby to do I don't get it but we got lucky on getting this other same different tv sent to us. If anything breaks I will update again. Good luck consumers.The fact is this TV is still not all that good- I would never ever buy it again and if I didnt spend so much time on the phone with coby, amazon & the warranty square trade and paid such a small amount for a 46" I would have thrown the damn thing out the window & let my dogs pee on it. spend the extra 100 or so- I am sure it will be worth it in the end, plus I am sure I will be going through the same thing in a few months when something breaks on it.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for a bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: R T L
Reviews.Content: We went from a 32" tube to this, so you can imagine how much better this unit is compared to the one I was using.  There are slight delays in functionality but nothing a little patience won't get you by.  The picture quality is pretty good, the sound lacks a bit but I can't imagine another TV this thin with much better quality.  I guess you get what you pay for, but for a TV we may watch a few times during the week this one is fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Coby LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Chancy D Hill Sr.
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a while back from Amazon,I really think that for the purchase price its a very fine TVI think if your just looking for a TV thats user friendly then you will love this one!

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: G.G.
Reviews.Content: In 190 bucks a 32 inch LED is great......sound quality superb...picture is as expected and its works awesome with roku

Reviews.Title: Not bad for price
Reviews.Author: Molly
Reviews.Content: Most reviews here were dead on! Pretty bad flashlight effect during dark scenes. Flashlight meaning it looks like there is a light coming from the corners of the screen. Not noticeable during normal tv watching, only with dark scenes. Sound quality could be better. It does take a while to actually turn on after pressing power button.  I bought this for my bedroom and eventually it will be the guest room tv. I got it on sale for $299..... For that price, it's a great tv!

Reviews.Title: Coby 40 " TV
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon a few weeks ago. I must say after reading some of the reviews I almost didn't make the purchase. I'm glad I did it is a great LED TV the picture quality is very good and the sound is good . It is a great value for under $400.00. We use the TV in our bedroom and don't have anything other than cable hooked up to it if we want to watch a DVD we use our TV in our living room that has a 5 channel surround sound system. We had to play around with the picture settings to get the TV to come in like we wanted it to but it had lots of choices from dark picture to very bright. I would have given this a 5 star rating but it is slightly slow to come on and takes a couple of minutes before it is warmed up and you get the picture you programed it to. This doesn't bother myself or my wife but it may bother someone. I would highly recommend this as a second TV and a best value for the money.

Reviews.Title: Replaced after 3 days and returned after 60
Reviews.Author: GirleeGirl
Reviews.Content: My brother and I purchased this for our mother for mother's day.  It was a pretty good looking tv for the money, and it was much larger than the 32" we were replacing.  After only 5 days, it would not come on at all.  We had purchased the additional warranty, so we loaded it up and hauled it back and they simply gave us a new one.  Ok.. great.  The new one works great right out of the box. (that was May 14)  Then Saturday - July 28th, it did the same thing.  We picked it up and hauled it back AGAIN.  They were going to give us a 3rd t.v.  Instead, we purchased the 42" LG plasma for only $40 more.  It may not be LED, but i have the same LG plasma and it has worked great for years.I would not recommend this set at any price.  Well... maybe FREE.

Reviews.Title: Not working
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV as a gift. Upon setting it up, the TV would not turn on. Called COBY USA & dealing with them to have it fixed/replaced. Defective product. Will update review as I hear more.

Reviews.Title: good so far
Reviews.Author: VEEGEE
Reviews.Content: You don't get all the "bells and whistles" but you get what you pay for.  So far, I found this TV to have very good picture, good sound quality and tuner.  The on air HD programs came through very well.  Hope it stays that way for a while.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for the price!
Reviews.Author: Oscar Esquivel
Reviews.Content: Ok, I just throw my second tv to the trash (1 sharp, 1 samsung) so im done with the "brands" so i decide to buy this cheap tv. For my surprise the quality pic is excellente, the audio is good not great but which LED ultraslim have great sound? I think this is the better tv you could find for 300 buks.

Reviews.Title: Worst tv ever
Reviews.Author: Stephanie I Hubbart
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but I hate this tv so much that I'm going to take the time to warn others away from it.  It is horrible!  Do not buy!!!  Spend a little bit more and save yourself the frustration,  I started having problems within a few months and now the tv doesn't work at all.  I can't turn it on!!!!!  Sucky brand and sucky tv!!! Stay away!!!!!

Reviews.Title: muy bien
Reviews.Author: o
Reviews.Content: es un tv muy bueno,no crean en los malos comentarios, bueno, bueno  bueno  bueno  bueno  bueno  bueno  bueno  bueno  bueno

Reviews.Title: Spend a little more, get something better
Reviews.Author: Vincent Lee
Reviews.Content: Don't be cheap like me. I regret it now. A television is supposed to last you and your family many years of good memories....therefore, skip this television. It turns on, PS3 to HDMI connects, and the TV works but the overall quality is just bad.The blacks on this television is horrible. During scenes where there is darkness and light, like a movie character or a videogame character is in a dungeon with no light, it's hard to see unless you shoot up the brightness, but once the scene reaches a place with light, it's too bright. So an easier way to think of it is: the black doesn't balance well with color. The black is just too black.Another issue is the lights on the corners of the screen. The lights are used to light up the screen, but on the corner's they are very bright and it dims as is it nears the center. The corner of the screen should not be brighter than the rest of the screen. It's annoying to look at.Another issue is the sound. It sounds like a baby lion trying to roar like his father. The TV has a weak sound and when volume is turned up, there's a muffled sound to it, like the volume is too powerful for the TV's built in stereo to handle. The TV can't handle it's own sound limit and I never turn it up past 55 percent of the way. Standard definition televisions have better sound.Blu Ray and DVDs don't seem much different on this TV. Once we switched to a Samsung, the difference between Blu Ray and DVDs was crazy!! It seemed like you were the cameraman watching the actors in front of you....Our standard definition TV has lasted us 15 years and it's still running great. This Coby LED TV lasted us 2 years before we gave it to a local thrift store. The quality is so bad that I don't feel like watching anything or playing videogames on it. Spend some more and get a better quality television. I was being cheap and thought all LED TV's would be good, but I was wrong. Don't make the same choice I did by getting this TV.

Reviews.Title: Good deal on an ok TV.
Reviews.Author: Justin Walsh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed a replacement for a used TV we had for 4 years, so we searched online and found this for $300 and felt the timing was perfect. The picture and quality were a huge improvement over what we were using, and I was extremely happy with our purchase.About two months later ( just a couple of days ago) the TV would no longer turn on. It was getting power, but just wouldnt come on, the power lite would get brighter, than dim. We researched it, and found that this is a common problem with the TV, this really ticked me off, and I was worried the company would do nothing about it. Luckily we are still within warranty, so that has turned out not to be the case.If you buy this TV, make sure to keep all the paperwork, in case anything happens to it.

Reviews.Title: Great Price for Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. Anyone complaining has unrealistic standards. I got the 3 year warranty for under $40 on it just in case. Had it about 3 months and very happy.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Bob216
Reviews.Content: This TV is cheap, not just inexpensive, cheap. I would not buy this TV as my main TV. I put it in a bedroom so it is much easier for me to deal with its quirks and imperfections as I am not watching this set the most in my home. It has a good picture (if left in energy saving mode) and poor sound quality. At least on my set, if you change the picture settings in any way off of Energy Saving mode the next time you turn it on the LEDs will not light up and the picture will be so dim you can hardly see it. The LEDs come back on if you change back to energy saving mode and will come on the next time you power on the set if you leave it in this mode. The sound is not good but did not expect much from the speakers on a TV this cheap. It is "listenable" at least where you can at least understand dialog, etc. Other issues are the pretty bad "flashlight" effect in all four corners from the LEDs but only looks really bad on a very dark or black screen. Standard def programming is close to unwatchable I have noticed on this TV and even HD programming has some "ghosting" in some faster motion scenes. Again, both of these issues are tolerable for the shorter periods of time I use this set.I orginally bought this TV as a Christmas gift for my girlfriend's parents as they do not have an HD TV yet. I wanted another for my bedroom anyway so thought I'd try this TV out for a bit first to see if it was good enough to use as a gift for them. I found that it is not good enough for them to use as a main TV and we will be purchasing a slightly more expensive, but better name and quality TV for them for Christmas and I am keeping this cheapo in my bedroom.Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Lori D Morris
Reviews.Content: Wonderful purchase will do business in the future. For the price good not do better anywhere else and works well with our gaming system

Reviews.Title: Coby LED TV
Reviews.Author: sir manho
Reviews.Content: Overall great product! Definitely worth the money. Only bad thing is there's no headphone jack output... If u can handle that, this product is the shit.  Great for college kids.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: GENE        ROYAL
Reviews.Content: THE PICTURE AND SOUND ARE GREAT AS I HAVE HOOKED IT UP TO A SONY RECEIVER. I ALSO LIKE THE ADDITIONAL PORTS FOR CONNECTING OTHER ELECTRONIC DEVICES, SUCH AS DVD, VCR.COMPUTER ETC. AS OF NOW, A GREAT PRODUCT FOR MY PARTICULAR USES.

Reviews.Title: Coby TV 40 inch
Reviews.Author: Janey
Reviews.Content: The speaker and sound sounded like a portable radio, very poor quality. Coby said we should add a speaker system. We purchased an $80 RCA speaker to make the sound acceptable.Something potential customers should know.

Reviews.Title: Quality VS Price
Reviews.Author: grouchin
Reviews.Content: I expect reviews to reflect a customers view of the product without carrying a you get what you pay for edict. I suppose that means I was prepared to get a product that was satisfactory at best. I was wrong. This television has a terrible picture and the edges bleed white into the pictures six to seven inches. My window to return this item has passed so I plan on sticking it in the garage to watch while I avoid the aggravation I would feel sitting in my living room looking at this poor picture. I don't blame Amazon for this. The product was offered and I threw my money down. In short, save yourself some mild kicking your self in the butt, and spend a few more bucks and get a good TV. Not this, Coby LEDTV4026 40-Inch 1080p LED HDTV/Monitor Earl

Reviews.Title: It Worked Great!... While It Lasted. :-(
Reviews.Author: Piff
Reviews.Content: I bought this television even though I saw that it didn't have too many great reviews.  I decided to give it a chance anyway since it came with a 30-day warranty.  I thought that I was one of the lucky ones who received a working television.  This television had a really nice picture, coloring, and sound for a 40-inch tv of such a cheap price.  I thought that I was getting a deal until three days passed.  After that, the tv wouldn't even turn on.  I rarely watch tv either, so I doubt if it was caused by the television being on too long or something like that.  Amazon's return/refund policy is amazing, so I had no trouble at all returning this.  The UPS person is coming today to return it.  I just wanted to share my experience of this television with potential buyers.  It may look great and be a steal, but there are some issues with it that should have been addressed by Coby before it was sold to the public.

Reviews.Title: Pretty bad
Reviews.Author: slam it
Reviews.Content: This thing was too cheap to bother sending back, but if I knew how crappy it was I would have spent a little bit more to buy a name brand.  The picture isn't very sharp, and the sound is really poor.  Even the remote needs to be pointed directly at the sensor for it to work.  I'm just using it as an extra tv in my office so I can put up with it, but if I had bought this for a bedroom or living room I'd have sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy setup, poor audio
Reviews.Author: Tracy Williams
Reviews.Content: Nice low price TV.  Easy to set up but sound quality is lacking.  Could barely hear with typical background noise.  Ended up having to purchase a soundbar which cancelled out savings in money and energy use.

Reviews.Title: great TV, great picture
Reviews.Author: saikodynameeks
Reviews.Content: Great TV for a great  price! Was a little nervous because COBY isnt well known and everyone seemed biased in favor of Samsungs but i didnt wanna spend a fortune so i took a chance on this TV. Works great and i v had n problems in the two months i v had it. Great picture!

Reviews.Title: Cheap junk
Reviews.Author: C. Bradley
Reviews.Content: You know what they say, if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.  The sound was horrible, although that seems to be a problem for most of the inexpensive TVs these days.  The big problem was that it was poorly constructed and it pinched the edges of the screen, making them a different color from the rest of the screen.  In the end we returned it.  Spend $100 more and get a good TV.

Reviews.Title: Coby LEDTV4026 40-Inch 1080p LED HDTV/Monitor
Reviews.Author: Roberto Lopez
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this TV,yes is a LED but the picture is not good and the sound is ok. Better for your buck is the TCL-LCD40"mush better picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: Good for its price
Reviews.Author: zberger
Reviews.Content: This tv is great for its price however I do have a few gripes:1) The LED backlights are not evenly distributed so there are patches of bright spots2) The on screen display is far too small to read3) The TV is not very responsive, powering on and powering off take near to 10s each and changing channels takes 5s

Reviews.Title: Worth the sales price of $338 - and not much more.
Reviews.Author: TT "-TT"
Reviews.Content: This would have been a great TV if COBY had perhaps spent more time tweaking the firmware.  Here's what I've noticed- The flash lighting others mentioned isn't bad, and had people here not mentioned it, I probably would not have known to look for it or noticed it.- If you expect to watch anything but the news, you will want to get a decent pair of speakers.  The built in speakers are at best equal to that of a clock radio, with the fidelity of a mobile phone playing music  The trouble is without an analog audio output your choices are limited to something that will accept an optical digital input - or using the controllable outputs of a cable, satellite or antenna box.- Via HDMI, I could not get the 1920x1080 resolution from my laptop to display properly without some scaling, stretching or overscan.- There is a curious amount of automatic contrast/noise-reduction processing going on that at times make flesh tones look very pasty and blurry.  On screen graphics, like those shown when watching a weather report appear very sharp, but as soon as a person appears their face and exposed fleshtones look very blurry and blocky.- The "video noise reduction" setting was always greyed out when using HDMI inputs- The TV does have settings for overscan, stretch/zoom adjustment, and dynamic contrast.- The TV does take 5-6 seconds to turn on.  The blue light blinks briefly and gets brighter when it is being switched on.  A message that says "Powering off...." or similar appears momentarily before the TV turns off.- The remote control is actually very nicely designed and does not look like a generic remote, but some of the commands are not debounced properly which makes accidental "double-clicking" very easy.- The LED backlight is, very bright, which makes this TV great for bright, sunny locations like a kitchen.If only COBY would address as many of the above issues as they can in a firmware upgrade (there is a USB service port on the side), this would probably merit the $400+ non-sale price.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Defective unit received - DO NOT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: FGC "Frank"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: This is unit #4. The box appeared to be fine. I took it out to find it has a large crack in the bezel frame near the screen. I didn't even try to go any further. I am extermely frustrated with this entire process that started on 12/18. The final result is another trip to the UPS shipping facility, lost work hours, no TV for the holidays and a 4 year warranty from FairTrade that I need to cancel as Amazon does not handle that for you. What an incredible waste of time and effort. Take my experience as a worse case scenario maybe, but it could have been you. I hope you have better luck.This is first one I actually received after three attempts by Amazon to get it to me. I wanted it by Christmas, however, the first one was never delivered due to being damaged in transit, so the shipper did not attempt delivery to me (thank goodness). The second one was mis-labeled and I have no idea what happened to it. I just know I never received it. Amazon dispatched another one. The third arrived! I was all excited just to see the box. I took it out of the box, hooked it up and turned it on. The upper left side of the screen had a triangular area that was almost pure white unless the screen was completely dark. Obvious defect. So, repackaged and off to the shipper I go to return. Other than the frustration so far, Amazon has been great about keeping me informed and providing good return RMA service. I must say that the unit I saw, well if not for the flaw, would have looked good and I would have been happy with it. Waiting for the replacement unit sent 2nd day air at no charge either way. I will update when I receive the next unit.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: gordon1227
Reviews.Content: The  TV is very good.''The only drawback is that,the speaker is not very good .In short, I am satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: TV DOA...
Reviews.Author: ckredwing
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV after reading the reviews and checking out the specs of the TV. It was to be for Christmas and to replace an old Tube TV that is in out Living Room.  After setting up the TV per the manual, I plugged it in and the blue led light came on. But after clicking the power button on the tv itself, the led light went off and would not come back on.  I unplugged the tv and again the LED came on, this time pressed the power button on the remote, again, the light went out and no power to the TV.  Called Customer support (COBY) and they were closed  (apparently, only open from 9m-9pm EST) but then emailed them to get support started.  I will wait for their answer, but if it does not happen before this weekend, I will be returning it to Amazon and try a different brand.  Will update when something happens.Update... 12/21/11Finally got a hold of COBY, They advised me to return it to the store..  I am returning it tomorrow (Thanks Amazon for making it very easy :) ) and Amazon is shipping a replacement.  It will not be here by Christmas, but what else can I do.  Will try the replacement.  If it does not work, well, it also will be returned for a refund and I'll buy another brand.  This will be COBY 's last chance for our family.

Reviews.Title: nice but needs more audio
Reviews.Author: wind646
Reviews.Content: This tv was nice ,bright and clear but need more audio.So far i gave it 9 out of 10.ease of set up i would rate it 8 of 10 coz of the location of the terminals, you would twist the tv backward to connect all this plugs but a little work is worth it.the tv was good and good price from amazon which is the lower i could find in the internet.

Reviews.Title: Great bed room TV
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: Had this for 14 months . Use it for our bedroom and would recommend it for this task. I don't think I would use it for my main TV. But the price was right.

Reviews.Title: Very low quality - will not last.
Reviews.Author: Al "rox4jox"
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV because the price was so good, but in retrospect, we should have spent the extra money for a higher-quality product. Initially, the picture quality was quite good. The sound was poor, but we expected that and hooked it up to 'sound bar' speakers. After a few months, the screen went blank, never to turn back on again. Fortunately, we had purchased an extended warranty, so we were able to get a new set. The second set lasted longer, close to a year, before half the LED backlights stopped working. So the picture is now dim and unusable unless the room is dark.Bottom line: You get what you pay for. You will end up saving money buying a more expensive but higher quality TV. We should have taken the extended warranty money and contributed it toward buying a better TV.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Berke
Reviews.Content: TV is awful not a good picture or sound and the reviews said it would be good but it wasn't

Reviews.Title: Purchase was unusable
Reviews.Author: Reneta  A. Hurt
Reviews.Content: Upon opening the package, we found a TV, but no remote control, power cord for the TV, or AV cable for the TV although the enclosed manual indicated that such should be found in the box.  There were two instruction manuals enclosed in the box (the only enclosures in the box) for both the Coby TV, and one for a Sharp LCD TV.To date, our inquiries regarding this TV have netted us nothing but an automated email saying someone was out of their office until October 1.i would not recommend this TV to anyone since I believe most people who purchase a TV plan to watch it.

Reviews.Title: Coby = Crap
Reviews.Author: BD "BD"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these in July 2012, granted it was outside on a covered back porch but it lasted one year before the volume button got hung.  It now automatically turns itself all the way up when you turn it on.  Prior to that, everytime you turned it on you had to change the picture settings because it would get stuck on a very dim picture.  I ordered a replacement 2 weeks ago and when I took it out of the box the picture was so faint you couldn't even see it.  Even trying to change the settings it got no better on this one.  I wouldn't waste my money on this TV again.  If someone gave me one for free I probably wouldn't take the time to even mount it.  Regarding the outdoor TV, I have a friend with an LG and another with a Westinghouse.  Both have been outside for 3+ years with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased customer
Reviews.Author: J. L. Moctar
Reviews.Content: I ordered this just a few days before Christmas in 2011, as a way to celebrate upcoming changes. I'm very pleased. Television doesn't play a big role in my life, so this was larger then I was looking for, but it was such a good price, and with Amazon Prime I payed just about $4 extra to have it delivered the next day. The whole transaction was flawless.I've now had the tv several years. I'm cutting cable and adding both a streaming video player and an indoor antenna (also purchased from Amazon).  I'm still very happy with this television.  No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: The TV was damaged, and is in Venezuela, as I get my answer?
Reviews.Author: Jorge J.
Reviews.Content: The TV was damaged, and is in Venezuela, as I get my answer?. It's my uncle if I could respond to mail from my uncle who speaks good English. thanks.  juannavarrete_p@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: TV won't turn on
Reviews.Author: JMC
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV on a gold box deal during christmas season.  It was a great price and did what it was supposed to do.  Its a cheap TV for the guest room.  Unfortunately it won't turn on anymore.  Blue LED light is on till you hit the power button.  Starts to power up and then nothing.  Even the LED light turns off.  Very disappointed.  Its not like its used a lot.  Will try to contact customer service tomorrow, but after reading other reviews, not too hopeful.

Reviews.Title: Picture is so blurry
Reviews.Author: dantheman
Reviews.Content: Well designed.  Picture quality is so HORRIBLE.  I was so regret to buy this tv and end up replaced it in couple months.COBY isn't right product in the market for me.

Reviews.Title: Good value for  an led tv
Reviews.Author: Mary Kay Miluski
Reviews.Content: This tv was priced right when I got it; good contrast ratio and hz.  Hard to find a comparable tv and price now.

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: Jesus Rivas
Reviews.Content: buena calidad y todo muy bien en el envio muy sastifecho con la compra... recomendado para otras ocaciones y compras

Reviews.Title: I love Coby
Reviews.Author: Tammy
Reviews.Content: I got this Coby and love it it came very fast. I have bought 2 of this kind and love the picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price $$$
Reviews.Author: Andrew Thomson
Reviews.Content: The spotlights are definitely present in the corners, but the only time it is really noticeable is when the screen is showing very dark colors (night scenes or scenes with a lot of black). For the price of this (I bought it on special for $300) 40", you can't expect perfection. This is and upgrade from our 29" CRT monitor.  Been very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Coby TV's are just not good
Reviews.Author: Kim M. Murphy "Kim"
Reviews.Content: I brought this tv once at Amazon and once at another location and I'm sorry to say I can't get over just how crappy it is! (returned both) The picture quality is clearly inferior to other tvs and the sound OMG! just awful. it sounds like it's coming through a tin can. It doesn't help that the speakers already sound shorted out in some way when you receive the tv new (I heard a shhhh and hummm sound.) What a terrible product. Shame on you Coby...my advice pay a little extra and get a decent TV.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Donny Henthorne
Reviews.Content: Great value TV for the price good picture sound not so good would tell a friend to buy this TV

Reviews.Title: Coby 32" flat screen LED onitor.
Reviews.Author: Carole Bergen
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV/monitor to replace an old smaller monitor for my computer. I received the productsooner than I expected, It was well packaged, and had easy to follow instructions for setting it up.The color and clarity are outstanding, and I am really pleased at the value of my purchase. In terms of price/performance, it is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Decent very low-end LED TV
Reviews.Author: PWU "PWU"
Reviews.Content: I've already had LED HDTV. I bought this item as a computer monitor, considering it had almost the same price as what I spent on a 20" monitor 5 years ago. This one is a very good as a monitor, and it can also serve as a TV, a low end TV that you only use in the bedroom, instead of the living room or family room.Pros:1) Very light and slim design and you can easily move it to anywhere2) Very bright and we can almost use it as emergency light at night3) Loud sound (in contrary to the previous review)Cons:1) Torch lights as described in the previous reviews2) The pictures lack of dynamic range, even when we decreased the brightness3) Very annoying pixelation when the TV signal format is worse than 1080i4) Very slow picture response. When you watch a football game, you see the fuzzy images all over the players.If you compare it to a name brand LED TV, it is only worthy 1 star. Consider its price, I give it 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Pefect for gaming
Reviews.Author: S. Pestana
Reviews.Content: My husband uses this with is P3S. He loves it! Great clarity for the games. It arrived fast with Prime shipping and no issues at all. Easy to step and start using.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: The tv was a gift for my parents, they were so ecstatic. It has a great picture, easy to use.  Amazon did a great job with the purchase and delivery. I'm a very pleased customer.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price but not much more
Reviews.Author: David MacKenzie
Reviews.Content: I bought this item on sale for $300.For that price, it was a hands down winner.  For a higher price, I wouldn't think so.The ghosting on this TV is horrible.  The speakers are very quiet, and there is no Audio-out feed so I can't listen to TV on an external receiver.  Other then that, everything is just as expected for a TV of this value.

Reviews.Title: not so good
Reviews.Author: S. Miles "smashes"
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV because it was on sale. Only to find out Coby is not a great brand in TV;s. The picture is definately not sharp as a Sharp TV a freind of mine has. Next time this comes on sale , i would recc. thinking over it before you buy . Better to go with a brand name who is more recog. such as Sharp , Toshiba , panasonic etc

Reviews.Title: COBY LEDTV
Reviews.Author: Yesenia de Leon
Reviews.Content: GREAT TV FOR PRICE AND VERY GOOD SOUND I BUY 1 FOR MY KIDS AND I AM SO GLAD BECAUSE IS A VERY GOOD TVGREAT TV FOR PRICE

Reviews.Title: Amazing deal!
Reviews.Author: flylo
Reviews.Content: Great picture & sound, bought a Roku & everything works,looks & sounds great. Maybe I got lucky but I have none of the problems the negitive reviews mention. Best part is it cost $385-10% my CC offered, then they lowered it to $335 & refunded the diff so it cost under $300. I'm very pleased & recomend it & Amazon. Sears wanted $799 at the time. Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: A very good TV for the price. Light weight made it easy to mount.I look forward to buying another when they come out with a larger model.

Reviews.Title: Best picture for the price.
Reviews.Author: Arcade
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at the $388 price point because I was looking for the lowest price 40" LED with the best picture I could find. This TV was perfect. I do not care a thing about the sound quality because I never planned on using the built in speakers anyway. I am not even using it as a regular Television. I got it to use as a 40" virtual pinball playfield for my pinball cabinet. I must say, it looks and plays spectacular. Over 100 full screen pinball tables in 1080P resolution.My only gripe about the set is that it does not power on automatically when the PC boots up. You have to use the remote control to power it on, which is a bit of a pain.Oh yea, the company that packed it up and shipped it did a horrible job. The stand, remote and wires were all loose in the box and banging around. It was a miracle that the screen made it to me unscratched.

Reviews.Title: Coby LED 40" TV
Reviews.Author: Aunt Jan
Reviews.Content: I love this flat screen TV. I took a chance and ordered it online right before the holidays.  The picture is very clear.  Once in a while, I have some problems with the on/off feature but I can straighten it out. I am not sure if it is the signal or what.  The price was fantastic and overall I am very pleased with this Amazon purchase.

Reviews.Title: A LOT of bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: B. J.
Reviews.Content: Seems to be a quality TV for a very reasonable price.  Great picture, & good sound, nice remote, what else can you ask for?  My only negative surprise was that it doesn't seem to have a headphone jack for my wife's headphones... ...she watches TV at night when I'm sleeping.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: chi
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for clear picture for digital and HD channel. Takes forever to turn on/off.  But Great for gaming!

Reviews.Title: Audio needs work
Reviews.Author: clecce
Reviews.Content: I'm only giving it a 3 star rating because the audio on the TV is below sub standard.  The picture is clear, however, there is an extreme delay between using the remote and when the changes occur on screen.  I guess you get what you pay for.  In hindsight, I would wait and spend an additional 100 dollars to get something of a better quality and sound.  I will have to spend at least that to get a surround sound system to make the TV worth while.  the sound is mono and, even in the bedroom where I have the TV, it sounds muted and like an AM receiver from the 60's.

Reviews.Title: Good price but.... no way to connect cable and DV player at same time
Reviews.Author: WildPitch.TV
Reviews.Content: C'mon COBY - you must know how people us TV's in this century. I should not have to connect and re-connect cables every time I switch from TV to video!

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: I bout this tv for my fiance and he loves it! great picture quality also! only this is that you will need a surround syslem to go along with it to give the sound more ooomph! other than that, he could not be happier and neither could i!

Reviews.Title: Returning for sound
Reviews.Author: C.J.'s Mommy
Reviews.Content: I bought this T.V. on a cyber Monday sale.  I looked pretty carefully at the reviews first and decided for the price to take a chance.  Unfortunately the sound quality is so bad that I am returning it.  I think it has something to do with the speaker being on the bottom underside.  It sounded way too mono.  I was surprised since it is Dolby.  My husband and I tossed around the idea of getting a speaker bar after reading some of the other reviews, but what would be the point of getting a cheap T.V. if you have to spend another $100 to get some sort of decent sound.  The picture is ok and liveable for the price paid.  I've purchased a no name television before, i.e. Proscan from Costco, and love it.  We will be spending a little extra money to get quality for the replacement we purchase.

Reviews.Title: Ease of shopping 2 day delivery excellant condition of merchandice
Reviews.Author: Deno1500
Reviews.Content: Coby 40" widescreen led/lcd was an easy of of box to setup and to operaton in less than 15minutes. This is an excellant Hdtv widescreen .It also I might add frm web purchase to delivery in less than 48 hours is to be commended, coupled with a BlueRay Sony 3D internet connected will complete my second home system. Amazon, your network online syetem are the best . Again Yhank you , happy Holidays & a terrific New Year Dgm1492  12/14/2011 3:26PM 1526HRS

Reviews.Title: No audio out ports!
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I'm returning this TV after using it for a couple of weeks.  It has horrible, I mean HORRIBLE sound quality that I can't get over.  It wouldn't be that bad if I could connect speakers to it but it doesn't even have a headphone jack or any other audio output (except for digital audio).  I can't stress how bad the sound quality is on this TV.  The video quality is good and the TV is pretty thin.  However, I'd stay away!

Reviews.Title: bad
Reviews.Author: Carlos Castillo
Reviews.Content: this tv has a problem for ignition.turn to control costs not recommended.bad, bad.the times I've tried it on to see it, I find it hard.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Evans-CAS
Reviews.Content: Stopped working within a month. The warranty is useless as I have to pay out of pocket to ship the item back to the manufacture and include a money order for return shipping costs. Buy this TV only if you want a headache.

Reviews.Title: Big picture, crap sound
Reviews.Author: rommyc "rommyc"
Reviews.Content: You really should test drive this before you buy it, if you are planning to use the sound from the onboard speakers.  Because not only are they quite faint, but when you can hear them you'll realize it wasn't worth the effort.  I seriously have to crank the volume all the way up to try and hear a movie.  If you will only be running sound through a stereo or HT setup, it might suffice.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is very poor.
Reviews.Author: Satisfied tn resident
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why any company would sell a product that had such poor quality picture.  If you are going to take the time and money to make something why wouldn't you put enough effort into it to make it good.  The picture on this TV is so fuzzy it's unbelievable.  If it wasn't such a hassle we would return it.  For a hundred dollars more at your leading discount store you could have a beautiful pictured TV.

Reviews.Title: BETTER THAN THAT
Reviews.Author: lets try
Reviews.Content: THE REVIEWS I READ WERE SOMEWHAT NEGATIVE. I BELIEVE THEY WERE WRITTEN BY MORE "FEATURE' ORIENTED PEOPLE THAN I. THE TV WORKS!!I GET THE CHANNELS THAT ARE AVAILABLE TO ME, AND THAT IS WHAT I REQUIRE IN A TV SET.THE DELIVERY WAS EVEN QUICKER THAN PROMISED, SO I GIVE YOU-ALL A BIG THUMBS-UP.THANK-YOU

Reviews.Title: Bad purchase
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: Unless you have excellent hearing,stay away from this TV. Set volume up to the max of 63 and still is barely audible.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, kinda bad speakers, no audio out.
Reviews.Author: Josh Thacker
Reviews.Content: The title pretty much sums it up for me. The TV is pretty slim and it has a wonderful picture for the price. There is also a slight flashlight effect as others described, but it is hardly noticeable. The only con I can think of really is that there isn't an Audio-out, so I can't hook up any speakers. The speakers in the TV are kind of bad, so I'd prefer to use something else. I could be overlooking something though. Great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Worked for 1 Day!
Reviews.Author: TikaChew
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based on price and specs. I wish I would have stayed away from it. It worked for 2 days. Now it just sits with a blue LED light and nothing else. Seems like a common problem with Coby TV's but I was hoping since this was a newer model they would have fixed that issue.Anyway Amazon was awesome and got it next day and are taking care of the return shipping costs. Going to pay the extra money for quality.

Reviews.Title: Bright Television
Reviews.Author: Doomaster120
Reviews.Content: This 40 inch TV is big for starters and is very bright at default settings. It seems to use ~90 watts no matter what preset I use or how low I turn down the brightness, contrast and color settings can anyone explain this? As a reviewer has mentioned this TV is great for video games. It isn't half bad for everything else as well. I am also missing the screw for the base of the TV and can anyone please tell me what screw I need to secure the TV to the base? I bought this TV for $223.17 on amazon Ahahahaha and when I got there when a few more of these on sale for about the same price. This TV is really Bright when displaying anything with a white background.

Reviews.Title: low quality basic led tv, you get what you paid for
Reviews.Author: Y. You
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV and tried it out, here's what I have to say.Pros:It's a LED TV that works and that is all.Cons:Very basic menu interface, no fancy features or settings.HDMI port native resolution is 720p, if you set it to 1080p from pc using hdmi connection (trust me, my computer has no problem, my viewsonic 27" 1080p led monitor works fine, my video card is gtx 560 ti 2gb), the desktop/picture go over the border on four sides of the TV and you have to use nvidia control panel to shrink the image to a lower resolution, that becomes a custom random resolution, that really bugs me, random non-typical tajt;ljatat X rj;lteskjat resolution instead of 1920 X 1080 which is what the TV is advertised as.The picture quality is only okay, since hdmi port is not 1080p native, that lowers the quality even further using a custom lower resolution.Conclusion:You get what you pay for, if you want decent TV, pay more for a better brand.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Sean Thomas Maples
Reviews.Content: I just bought this TV and within 30 minutes of setting it up I was packing it up to return. The picture quality is absolutely atrocious. The pixels all seem to stick together, forming shapes that makes it look like a pointillism painting; and that is when there is very little movement. When you get into a scene with any movement things start to become pixelated and blurry. The color is off. The viewing angles are poor. And it's slow to turn off, and unresponsive to the remote. I tried it with my Dish HD DVR, my Xbox 360, and my PC, using Component, HDMI, and VGA, all awful quality.This TV is not a deal. It is a piece of junk, Buyer Beware!

Reviews.Title: power button did not work
Reviews.Author: peacock
Reviews.Content: Got this t.v. at a used price on amazon for my sons birthday. cost 303 dollars. Couldnt get the power to turn on. when it finally would turn on, it couldnt be turned off. the return policy was awesome though and without hassle. got a better tv

Reviews.Title: Broke after one day. STAY AWAY!
Reviews.Author: Eccitaze
Reviews.Content: Pros-Great picture quality for the priceCons-EVERYTHING ELSE.Problems started as soon as I unboxed it. The first thing you need to know is that it's wobbly. The TV is connected to the stand at a single point by a single screw. I screwed it in quite snugly, but the TV still wobbles for a good 5 seconds if you adjust it at all. Considering that the stand is supposed to hold that thing up for multiple years, that is very worrying out of the box.The second thing you need to know is that the sound quality is *terrible.* We plugged in our 360 and at half volume the sounds the console made while we navigated through the menu were distorted and shrill. Turning it down fixed it, but the simple fact is that even when the bass setting was at max, there was literally no bass at all in the TV, making everything sound tinny and hollow. Worse yet, the only audio output it has is coaxial digital out.So because of the awful sound quality, we went out and purchased a $139 audio system to get a usable setup. During the process of moving it, we had to (VERY GENTLY) reposition the TV and unplug it. After we installed everything and plugged it back in, we started everything up... only to discover that the TV would no longer start up. Going to return this TV and ask for a different make and model. Stay away!

Reviews.Content: Took it out of the box, set it up, connected cable, DVD player and..............no picture. Tech support advised me to return it?
